tooltipsworksystem.name: The name of this Work System. (Examples Include: Sales, Human Resources, Information Technology, Production, Finance, Purchasing.)
tooltipsworksystem.Management system: A listing of the management systems that work across multiple phases to ensure that value of the work. (Note: Use the examples in your workbook.)
tooltipsworksystem.worktype: A descriptive label that names the different work types that flow through the Work System. (Example: High Touch, Low Touch, No Touch
tooltipsworksystem.managementrail: A simple, concise statement that articulates how work is enabled and ensured to perform.
tooltipsworksystem.leadershiprail: A simple, concise statement that articulates the purpose ('why') the work is being performed
tooltipsworksystem.pageowner: The name(s) of the person(s) that owns this Work System. (Hint: Whenever possible this should be one person.)
tooltipsworksystem.phasepurpose: A simple, concise statement that identifies 'why' this particular phase of work exists
tooltipsworksystem.phasemeasure: A list of potential measures for work in each phase. (Note: In each phase you can always measure 4 items: 1) Time in the phase, 2) First Time Quality, 3) Total Cost, 4) Feedback
tooltipsworksystem.phase: The name of each phase of work that best describes the work steps
tooltipsworksystem.stepsofwork: A descriptive label of the process steps that are done in a phase to move to the next gate. (Note: The Dresser Drawer, action verbs, along a continuum of detail/granularity - does it allow the story to be told.)(Note: The order of steps is very important to create flow.)
